revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Verizon |model=One |revision=(VZ1) |serialnum_prefix= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=09/10/2007 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=OpenPeak |manuf_model=OP2207015 |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=VoIP handset base station, analog phone gateway |fcc_id=VGBW4BOP2207015 |ic_id=619A-A90VZ10X |us_id=5KPDL01AA90VZ10XX |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Freescale Semiconductor |cpu1_model=i.MX31C;(PCIMX31CVMN4); |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand=Analog Devices |cpu2_model=ADSP-BF536 |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=8 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |ram1=64 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram2= |ram2_brand=Samsung |ram2_model= |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip1_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |addl_chips= |flags=touchscreen, DECT |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} '''US DECT BASE UNIT''' :''VZ1 Handset (OpenPeak Inc.)'' *[http://newscenter2.verizon.com/press-releases/verizon/2007/verizon-unveils-1.html '''Verizon''' press release] :This was targeted for FiOS use at one point.. :but it is unknown if it was even rolled out *[http://onlinehelp.verizon.net/consumer/bin/pdf/VzOneUserGuide.pdf ''User manual for a different looking device'']
This device is using a [http://www.bdtic.com/winbond/communication/ '''Winbond''' W93560DG DECT baseband chip].
It appears to be using a '''Murata''' / '''Sychip''' (or some other vendor) WiFi module.
*The power adapter shown in the FCC photos is a '''Ktec''' KSAH0500500T1M3 :100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 1.2A -> 5VDC, 5.0A
